title: SH 360 Photos

pageHeader.title: Roadside Views
pageHeader.lastUpdated: Page created June 18, 2008. Last updated February 8, 2018 (review and update captions)

text: After the sign photos, these photos start at the north end at TX 121 near DFW Airport, and proceed south to Mansfield. 2018 status: Many photos have become obsolete due to construction to widen the freeway, including nearly all photos south of I-30. The tollway south of I-20 opened in 2018.

images.caption: This sign at Division Road shows the freeway name. The palm tree behind the sign is the subject of an interesting side-story on page 454 of the book, "The Heartwarming Story of the Division Street Palm".

imageStatus.note: The sign and palm tree were removed when the freeway was rebuilt and expanded, from 2009 to 2012. The palm tree was relocated to Carrollton.

images.caption: The freeway alignment through Arlington was originally Watson School Road. The frontage road is still designated with the original name.
Looking north along the northbound lanes with the merge with TX 121 ahead.

imageStatus.note: Collector-distributor lanes were built in 2017 as part of the DFW connector project.

images.caption: Looking north along the northbound frontage road with the freeway terminus at SH 121 just ahead.
At Stone Myers, looking northbound.
Looking north from the Glade road overpass
Another view looking north from the Glade road overpass.
Looking north from the Mid-Cities Blvd overpass
Looking north from FAA road, just south of the interchange with SH 183
Looking south at FAA road
Looking north near Riverside
Looking north at Post and Paddock
Looking north at Carrier Parkway, with law enforcement positioned to make a bust
Looking north at Avenue K, with Bell Helicopter on the right.
Looking south at Avenue K
Looking north at Division Street, near the General Motors assembly plant, showing the original freeway. This section has been rebuilt and widened since the photo was taken.

imageStatus.note: This section was rebuilt and widened, completed around 2013.

images.caption: At Mitchell street in Arlington

imageStatus.note: In 2018 work started on a $53 million project to add a main lane in each direction.

images.caption: Looking south at the four-level interchange at I-20
Another view of the interchange at I-20, looking south
End of the main lanes north of Sublett Road. In February 2015 TxDOT approved a $300 million plan to extend the main lanes southward as a toll road.

imageStatus.note: The tolled main lanes going southward opened in 2018.

images.caption: Another view of the end of the concrete of the main lanes.

imageStatus.note: The tolled main lanes going southward opened in 2018.

images.caption: Stop sign on the frontage road at New York street.

imageStatus.note: The tolled main lanes opened in 2018.

images.caption: Looking north along the southbound frontage road south of New York street.

imageStatus.note: The tolled main lanes opened in 2018.

images.caption: Frontage road near Broad Street

imageStatus.note: The tolled main lanes opened in 2018.
